NodeDetails.Comment: ![CDATA[This is the code for the system which has sourced this message. For request messages, this field has to contain the source code for the partner system as maintained within FLEXCUBE UBS. In case of response messages this field will contain "FLEXCUBE".]]

![CDATA[This is the component of FLEXCUBE for which this message is meant. Gateway supports both FLEXCUBE UBS and FLEXCUBE Investor Services. If the message is for FLEXCUBE UBS then this field should contain "FCUBS" and "FCIS" if meant for FLEXCUBE Investor Services. This field is case-sensitive.]]

![CDATA[This is the "unique" message ID for this message. In inbound messages, if this field is present then Gateway would perform technical duplicate recognition using this field. For all messages going out from Gateway, Gateway will populate a unique message ID in this field.]]

![CDATA[This is the correlation ID for the message. Gateway supports 2 correlation patterns, namely "Message ID to Correlation ID" (M2C) and "Correlation ID to Correlation ID" (C2C). While using asynchronous means of communication (like a JMS queue), the partner system can correlate the response received from Gateway to the request message sent by it using this field. If the correlation pattern is M2C then this field will contain the MSGID of the request message. If the correlation pattern is C2C then this field will contain the CORRELID of the request message.]]
![CDATA[This is the user id which will be used within FLEXCUBE to record the transaction. This needs to be a valid user id as maintained within FLEXCUBE.]]
![CDATA[This is the Branch of FLEXCUBE where the transaction would be recorded. This needs to be a valid Branch code as maintained in FLEXCUBE.]]
![CDATA[This field is applicable only if messages are being sent to FCIS using Gateway. This is the module id of FCIS where the transaction will be recorded.]]
![CDATA[This field should contain the code of the Service of FLEXCUBE which is being requested. This field is case-sensitive.]]
![CDATA[This is the operation of the service which is being invoked. This field is case-sensitive.]]

![CDATA[This is the code for the operation being invoked in the Source system. The code of Source Operation being sent needs to be maintained as a valid Source Operation for the Source within FLEXCUBE.]]
![CDATA[This is the user id in the Source system who is performing the action.]]

![CDATA[This the system for which this message is destined. In case of request messages to FLEXCUBE, it should be "FLEXCUBE". In case of response, the SOURCE from the request message is reproduced here.]]

![CDATA[In response messages, this is the ID sent by FLEXCUBE in case any overrides are encountered. In request messages, the source system is expected to reproduce the MULTITRIPID from the earlier received response if the source system accepts the overrides.]]
![CDATA[This is the function in FLEXCUBE which is being invoked. For integration scenarios this need not be sent. This is used by FLEXCUBE native user interface.]]
![CDATA[This is the action on the function being invoked. For integration scenarios this need not be sent. This is used by FLEXCUBE native user interface.]]
![CDATA[In response messages, FLEXCUBE will indicate the status of the request in this field. The various values are "SUCCESS", "WARNING" and "FAILURE".]]
![CDATA[Indicates Customer name 1]]
![CDATA[This uniquely identifies the product code in FLEXCUBE]]
![CDATA[This indicates a brief description of the product]]
![CDATA[Specifies a slogan for the product]]
![CDATA[Indicates any remarks related to the product]]
![CDATA[Specifies the date from which the product is effective]]
![CDATA[This indicates the date till which the product is valid. If there is no date specified then the product is valid forever and hence is open ended]]
![CDATA[The group to which the product is associated]]
![CDATA[Normal Rate variance i.e. no override is shown if the exchange rate variance is within this limit]]
![CDATA[Maximum Rate variance i.e. if the exchange rate variance is above this limit the transaction cannot be saved]]
![CDATA[Rate Code Preferred B Buy S Sell M Mid]]
![CDATA[This would be the various types of currency rates maintained like Cash Standard TT.]]

![CDATA[The minimum percentage variance (absolute value) between STANDARD mid rate and user input exchange rate above which the system must raise an override (provided it is below the Maximum Variance) but accept the transaction. In case of back valued transactions where exchange rate history will be used, it is the variance based on the then prevailing rate.]]
![CDATA[The maximum percentage variance from the standard rate and the user input rate above which the transaction should be rejected will be captured through this field.]]
![CDATA[Preference to support whether the payment should be done automatically or not. And at contract level could be overridden as Manual or continue to be auto A Auto M Manual.]]
![CDATA[On auto liquidation should partial liquidation can be allowed or not Y yes N no]]
![CDATA[Tenor]]
![CDATA[Preference to support Auto disbursement. A Auto M Manual]]
![CDATA[manner in which adjustment entries passed due to back dated adjustments should be handled for Debit entires]]
![CDATA[manner in which adjustment entries passed due to back dated adjustments should be handled for Credit entires]]
![CDATA[The field captures the minimum tenor that can be allowed for loan accounts created under this product]]
![CDATA[This would be the default tenor of loan accounts created under the product]]
![CDATA[The field captures the maximum tenor that can be allowed for loan accounts created under this product]]
![CDATA[This will give meaning to the maintenance of the tenors by providing the units of the tenor like be D Days W Week M Months Y Years]]
![CDATA[No of working days for which the system should attempt auto liquidation like D Days M Months Q Quarter S Semianual Y Yearly]]
![CDATA[This will determine if the Rollover will be system driven or not. If yes then upon maturity the Account will be rolled over automatically by the system Rollover like A Auto M Manual]]
![CDATA[This flag will determine if at the time of rollover the UDE value would be defaulted from the product or from the account like P Product C Contract]]
![CDATA[This determines if the Rolled over amount will include the Interest that is outstanding in the Rolled over contract Y yes N no]]
![CDATA[The date on which the prepayment will be effective B Baloon Payment T Change Tenor E Change Instalment]]
![CDATA[VAMI EMI calculation type S Single M Multiple]]
![CDATA[Account Opening Installment Calculation Type based on future rates S Single M Multiple]]
![CDATA[Indicates the INTEREST ONLY PERIOD]]
![CDATA[Indicates the INTEREST ONLY UNIT D Daily M Monthly Y Yearly]]
![CDATA[If the flag is turned on then any credit to the account will be taken against unpaid dues Y yes N no]]
![CDATA[This determines if the Loan account can be accessible for ATM operations Y yes N no]]

![CDATA[This preference determines if any feature such as interest rate, installment amount can be modified which will affect already paid schedules. If this is activated then the paid schedules will be recalculated and liquidations on them will be recognized as pending as appropriate Y yes N no]]

![CDATA[Preference to support Auto Liquidation. When auto liquidation is attempted if funds are not available then turning this flag on will track the amount to be liquidated as a receivable. So upon any subsequent credit the receivable will be blocked and allocated to the pending liquidation Y yes N no]]
![CDATA[This determines if Checks or coupon books for disbursement can be written against the Loan account Y yes N no]]
![CDATA[Requirement of Interest Statement required or not Y yes N no]]
![CDATA[Interest accrual for Special Interest Component Y yes N no]]
![CDATA[Indicates the CL Against Bill allowed to link multiple loans againt one bill Y yes N no]]
![CDATA[Indicates the Limits Product Y yes N no]]
![CDATA[Indicates the Notice Day Basis Product P Print A]]
![CDATA[The new field Packing Credit Product would be introduced in the CL Product Preference Screen and CL Accounts created with that product are eligible for linkage with BC Y yes N no]]
![CDATA[Indicates the NOTARY CONFIRMATION REQUIRED if a product is a mortgage product Y yes N no]]
![CDATA[This flag will determine if at the time of rollover the schedule would be defaulted from the product or from the account P Product C Contract]]
![CDATA[Indicates the Consider Branch holiday Maturity Y yes N no]]
![CDATA[Indicates the Ignore Holidays Maturity Value Date Y yes N no]]
![CDATA[Indicates the Schedule Movement Maturity Value Date]]
![CDATA[facility for Holiday Currency Maturity]]

![CDATA[This will determine if a schedule or value date etc falling on a holiday when moved to the next or prior working day if the working day falls in a different month whether to allow it or not Y yes N no]]

![CDATA[This will determine if a schedule or value date etc falling on a holiday when moved to the next or prior working day if the working day falls in a different month whether to allow it or not Y yes N no]]

![CDATA[If this is checked then when a particular schedule falls due on a holiday and hence is moved to the next or previous working day based on the module level branch parameters then the movement cascade to other schedules too If not then only the affected schedule will be moved to the working day and other schedules will be unaffected Y yesN no]]
![CDATA[Adhoc Holiday treatment if required Y yes N no]]
![CDATA[Holiday Check stores the type of holiday to be considered for scheduled date Currency C Local L Bought B]]
![CDATA[Indicates the Holiday Currency Scheduler Y yes N no]]

![CDATA[If checked then while processing schedules etc the system will ignore to check if a schedule falls on a holiday as per the holiday maintenance. On the actual day of processing it will be processed based on the Branch level holiday maintained for the module Y yes N no]]

![CDATA[While making payments to several schedules that are overdue, a default Order can be maintained upon which whether all components of a schedule would be cleared or if only one component for all the schedules be cleared. While making payments to several schedules that are overdue , a default .Order can be maintained upon which whether all components of a schedule would be cleared or if only one component for all the schedules be cleared. C Liquidate All Comp For A Date D Liquidate Each Comp Across Dates]]
![CDATA[To select after what duration the process should repeat D Daily M Monthly]]
![CDATA[Complete Accruals C Refund R]]
![CDATA[Par R Par/Discount D Par/Premium P Par/Discount Premium A]]

![CDATA[In case of prepayment of the amortized loan the principal will go down so now what should be the Recomputation Basis. Either the Tenor could be recalcualted keeping the Amount constant or amount could be recalcualted keeping the Tenor constant. T Recalculate Tenor I Recalculate Instalment Amount.]]
![CDATA[Prepayment of Amortised loan recomputaion of EMI type. S Single M Multiple]]
![CDATA[MInimum EMI Amount's Currency.]]
![CDATA[Minimum EMI Amount]]
![CDATA[Indicates the class code]]
![CDATA[Indicates the class code]]
![CDATA[Guarantor Account applicable status]]
![CDATA[Indicates the LEASE PAYMENT MODE. Y yes N no]]
![CDATA[cLoans which are issued against Salary are to be recovered from the Salary credit only and not from any other amount available in the account Y yes N no]]
![CDATA[Revolving Type Y yes N no]]
![CDATA[Indicates no of days for Credit]]
![CDATA[Open Line Loans Y yes N no]]
![CDATA[Auto Liquidation Percentage]]
![CDATA[Auto Liquidation Basis Minimum Amount Due M percentage of Amount Due A]]
![CDATA[Check this box to track multiple limit lines in case of joint venture. The settlement account for these loans will be the project account. Y/N(yes or no).]]
![CDATA[Indicates Retirees for advice]]
![CDATA[Indicates the flag to consider Grace Days Based On Working Days]]
![CDATA[If revision schedule holiday treatment should follow that of payment schedules.]]
![CDATA[If the holiday treatment for revision dates should be according to Local(LCL) or Currency(CCY) calendar.]]
![CDATA[If movement across months is allowed if the treated revision date is in a different month.]]
![CDATA[Check this box is automatic prepayment is enable for the loan account]]
![CDATA[In case the holiday treatment is CCY for revision schedules, the relevant currency code for the same.]]
![CDATA[If revision schedule should move Forward or Backward due to holiday treatment.]]
![CDATA[Specify the maximum bonus loan amount in percentage]]
![CDATA[Select the month from which the bonus payment have to be scheduled from the adjoining option list.]]
![CDATA[Select the month to which the bonus payment have to be scheduled from the adjoining option list.]]
![CDATA[Initial Cycle Up To]]
![CDATA[Check this box to apply cycle based interest rate for the product.]]
![CDATA[Select the convertible class code as maintained in Rate Based on Remaining Convertible Period Maintenanceâ€™ screen from the LOV]]
![CDATA[Initial Cycle Units]]
![CDATA[Indicates the Schedule Start Date Basis]]
![CDATA[Date of the authorization of the disbursement.]]
![CDATA[This indicated the status of the loan account. A --> Active V --> Reversed H --> Hold Y --> Uninitialized L --> Liquidated I --> Inactive U --> UnProcessed S --> Simulated C --> Closed]]
![CDATA[Authorization status of the disbursement. A-Authorised, U- Unauthorised.]]
![CDATA[Refer to the time when customers can avail repayment holidays owing to other expenses during the period LOV is used]]

![CDATA[Name of the component like principal, interest, penal interest etc. These components will then be defined in the components details screen. The components defined here would become available in accounting entries. LOV is used]]
![CDATA[The status that an installment will go through is specified here like NORM,WOFF etc. LOV used to get status code.]]
![CDATA[Indicates the status description]]
![CDATA[Adversity Level of the statuses of CL Account Status]]
![CDATA[Indicates the FLAG for STOP REVERSE]]
![CDATA[Readjustment in status CHANGE]]
![CDATA[Indicates whether compounding during status changes is required or not Y yes N no]]
![CDATA[Movement TO Status of the component like NORM WOFF etc LOV is used]]
![CDATA[Movement Rule to be applied]]
![CDATA[Movement type when should it be fired. M Manual A Auto B Both]]
![CDATA[This will determine whether complete accrual till status Change date is required or not Checkbox. Y yes N no]]
![CDATA[Specify the transaction code that should be used to post the accounting entry to the account head.]]
![CDATA[It is an indicator which specifies whether the entry posted should be credit C or debit D]]
![CDATA[A Flag used to identify if the entries should be shown separately or as a combined effect in statements, Y yes N no]]
![CDATA[Accounting role is used to denote the accounting function of a GL or Account. LOV is used.]]
![CDATA[An amount tag identifies the amount/value that is actually due for a component. LOV is used.]]
![CDATA[Indicates the role type.Y/N/Reimbursement.]]
![CDATA[Indicates the amount tag type. Y- Yes, N- No, C- Contra.]]
![CDATA[An MIS Head indicates the manner in which the type of entry should be considered for profitability reporting purposes.]]
![CDATA[Indicates the reval required - Online Revaluation refers to revaluation done on transaction amounts during transaction posting. Checkbox is sued.Y/N.]]
![CDATA[The GL to book the Profit. LOV is used.]]
![CDATA[The GL to book the Loss. LOV is used.]]
![CDATA[Indicates the reval rate code :Mid, Buy, Sale]]

![CDATA[If you opt for online revaluation, you need to associate the transaction code to be used for booking revaluation entries. The system will use this transaction code to track the revaluation entries. LOV is used.]]
![CDATA[The Holiday treatment indicator, Y/N]]

![CDATA[Checking for sufficient balance in the account for processing the transaction during the Batch for ALIQ event. Dropdown list options : Reject, Delinquency tracking, Force debit, Partial delinquency.]]
![CDATA[Allow the user to capture the delinquency product that has been defined in the delinquency module.]]
![CDATA[Number for pairing the similar accounting entries within an event.]]
![CDATA[You can associate a policy at one of the following points in time in a loan-event lifecycle:B Before Event, A After Event, O Both. The policy gets executed appropriately]]
![CDATA[The policies defined in the User Policy screen are available in the option list provided. Policies are used to handle special validations and operations on a loan. LOV is used]]
![CDATA[Indicates the message type : Select an advice from the option list provided]]
![CDATA[The Trigger indicates the appropriate time at which the advice is to be generated. Options: Input, Authorize.]]
![CDATA[This option may be used if you want to suppress the generation of some advices, Y/N]]
![CDATA[Indicates the importance of the advice generation. The priority may be: H High, M Medium, L Low]]
![CDATA[Collect charges for advice generation, Y/N]]
![CDATA[Format in which the advice should be generated. LOV is used]]
![CDATA[Indicates the charge component]]

![CDATA[Name of the component like principal, interest, penal interest etc. These components will then be defined in the components details screen. The components defined here would become available in accounting entries. LOV is used]]
![CDATA[Order of components for liquidation]]

![CDATA[Name of the component like principal, interest, penal interest etc. These components will then be defined in the components details screen. The components defined here would become available in accounting entries. LOV is used]]
![CDATA[The name of the component in the Product selected]]
![CDATA[Indicates type of the component]]
![CDATA[Indicator which will suggest if capitalization is to be done for the component for that schedule Y yes N no]]
![CDATA[Currency of the component]]
![CDATA[Selection of Interest Posting required or not Y yes N no]]
![CDATA[Indicates the Rep Type]]
![CDATA[Check Box for setting Propagation required flag]]
![CDATA[Indicates the selected component should be included in EMI calculation Y yesN no]]
![CDATA[Whether to use 30 or actual for a month with 31 days and whether to use 28 or 29 days for February for leap year can be decided based on US Euro or Actual Actual 30 Euro 30 US]]
![CDATA[Indicates the number of days for a year for the calculation of schedule amount. It can be 30 EURO, 30 US or Actual. 360/365/Actual.]]

![CDATA[The number of grace days allowed in case of non-repayments Penalty Grace days. This is not a Moratorium or a Holiday period. This is the no of days grace after which Penalty application will happen]]
![CDATA[Indicator which will verify the fund available before debiting : Y/N]]
![CDATA[Indicates whether No of Days and No of years will taken from Currency definition or not. Y yes N no]]
![CDATA[Option to select IRR required or not. Y Yes N No]]
![CDATA[Flag to denote if component is a Special Interest type. Y yes N no]]
![CDATA[For a Penalty component , the Penal basis will be displayed.]]
![CDATA[The periodicity of the element will be captured. D Daily P Periodic.]]
![CDATA[For Standard formula the User defined Elements to be used will be captured.]]
![CDATA[For Standard formula types , the basis element to be used can be captured.]]
![CDATA[nature of the balance that the component would hold. D Debit C Credit]]
![CDATA[If the loan contract provides a moratorium i.e. a repayment holiday in the beginning of the loan , then the Moratorium period can be captured]]
![CDATA[The units describing the Moratorium period can be captured as Days, Months , Years etc, Days Months Years D, M and Y respectively.]]
![CDATA[If accrual is yes then The frequency of accruing. Daily, Monthly, Half Yearly, Quarterly, Yearly.]]
![CDATA[The month on which accruals will begin For Frequencies such as Monthly, Semi annual etc, Jan; Feb;Mar;Apr;May;Jun;Jul;Aug;Sep;Oct;Nov;Dec]]
![CDATA[The start accrual Date for Frequencies like daily. (1-31)]]
![CDATA[For a prepayment threshold maintained,the currency in which it is maintained to be selected]]
![CDATA[Amount to maintain as threshold so that prepayment will be disalowed if residual amount after prepayment is less than the threshold amount]]
![CDATA[Check Box for setting Compounf on Overdue flag. Y/N]]
![CDATA[It indicates the liquidation mode of the component. It can be A (auto) or M (Manual). Auto/Manual.]]
![CDATA[Indicates the Basis Element Rounding Units]]
![CDATA[Indicates the Basis Element Rounding Method]]

![CDATA[The type of the Schedule for the Credit AdministrationThe valid schedule types are maintained in the valid table, these values are Principle type, rate type, capital type and disbursement type. P Payment,R Rate Revision,D Disbursement]]
![CDATA[The reference for the start date. Calender C, Value Date V]]
![CDATA[Select the frequency at which payments are made towards the liability. Daily, Bi-Weekly, Weekly, Bi- Monthly, Monthly, Quaterly, Half-Yearly, Yearly.]]
![CDATA[The unit for the schedules to be used with Frequency. D Daily M Monthly H Half Yearly Q Quarterly Y Yearly B Bullet W Weekly]]
![CDATA[Indicates the start day to initiate the schedule.1 Sunday 2 Monday 3 Tuesday 4 Wednesday 5 Thursday 6 Friday 7 Saturday]]
![CDATA[The start Date 1 to 31]]
![CDATA[The start month. 1 January 2 February 3 March 4 April 5 May 6 June 7 July 8 August 9 September 10 October 11 November 12 December]]
![CDATA[Indicates no of schedules for the component.]]
![CDATA[The formula to be used for calculating the repayments.]]
![CDATA[The Values maintained will be normal or moratorium which mean if moratorium the credit interests and charges are not settled but are accrued for a certain period. N Normal, M Moratorium]]
![CDATA[If the capital amount will be taken into account for the purpose of credit administration. Y/N]]
![CDATA[To schedule dues on a particular date of the month . Limit is Day in number between first day and last day of the month of the schedule 1-31]]
![CDATA[The formula to be used for calculating the repayments.]]
![CDATA[Round Upto Loans - Interest, Charges, Commission, Tax and Fee Rule Maintenance - Expression.]]
![CDATA[Indicates the flag, Y yes N no]]
![CDATA[Compounding in days.]]
![CDATA[On selection compounding will be on months.]]
![CDATA[Compounding in years.]]

![CDATA[Sequence number to track number of expressions for the rule name]]

![CDATA[The Result of the formula for the appropriate condition]]

![CDATA[The Trigger indicates the appropriate time at which the advice is to be generated. Options: Input, Authorize.]]
![CDATA[Indicates the generation of advices can be suppressed by activating this field.]]
![CDATA[Indicates the importance of the advice generation. The priority may be: H High, M Medium, L Low]]
![CDATA[Collect charges for advice generation, Y/N]]
![CDATA[Format in which the advice should be generated. LOV is used]]

![CDATA[Indicates the charge component]]
![CDATA[The policies defined in the User Policy screen are available in the option list provided. Policies are used to handle special validations and operations on a loan. LOV is used]]
![CDATA[You can associate a policy at one of the following points in time in a loan-event lifecycle:B Before Event, A After Event, O Both. The policy gets executed appropriately]]
